Legal_Issue: Whether the PRRA officer's decision was reasonable in rejecting new evidence and upholding the RPD's finding of an internal flight alternative (IFA) in Windhoek
Application_Facts: Applicant provided statutory declarations showing her uncle visited Windhoek seeking her; applicant feared forced marriage and abuse in Namibia
Decision_Outcome: PRRA officer rejected new evidence and upheld IFA finding
Court_Ruling: Court allowed judicial review, remitted case for re-determination, no costs ordered
Claimant_Status: Applicant seeking refugee protection in Canada
Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of forced marriage and abuse in Namibia
Assessment_Factor: Existence of internal flight alternative (IFA) in Windhoek
Applicable_Legislation: Subsection 113(a) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Procedural_Issue: Judicial review of PRRA officer's decision
Credibility_Assessment: Officer dismissed statutory declarations as self-serving
Application_Basis: New evidence arose after RPD decision or was not reasonably available before
Evidence_Assessed: Sworn statements from family members about uncle’s visit to Windhoek
Relief_Sought: Re-determination of PRRA application based on new evidence
Governing_Rule: PRRA officer must consider only new or previously unavailable evidence under subsection 113(a)
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Officer failed to properly consider key sworn evidence
Harm_Assessment: Risk of forced marriage and abuse if returned to Namibia
Cause_Description: Applicant feared forced marriage and abuse in Namibia, sought refugee protection in Canada, denied due to alleged IFA in Windhoek
Evidence_Handling: Officer dismissed new statutory declarations without sufficient justification
Legal_Provision_Violated: Subsection 113(a) – failure to properly assess new evidence
Evidence_Issues: Self-serving nature claimed, but evidence came from uniquely positioned family members
Legal_Provision: Subsection 113(a), Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Evidence_Assessment: Insufficient rebuttal of IFA despite new circumstances
Decision_Rationale: Officer unreasonably dismissed credible new evidence relevant to IFA assessment
Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to reassess IFA in light of new sworn evidence
